messages.subject: just goes to prove
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/4/03 3:34:36 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/4/03 3:34:36 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Shawn said he wanted to look at their bones and then I read a little bit
> about what the paleontologists said and I asked him if he knew what a
> paleontologist was and he said "a scientist that studies bones." >>

That was really cool that he was relating it that way, but a paleontologist
is actually a scientist that studies fossils.
Very different actually.
You could look up some stuff on Jack Horner and Egg Mountain, I bet he'd
really dig that! ( no pun intended ) hehe

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
